thread.title: TEMECULA: Teen Cole Criske to battle on 'The Voice'
thread.title_full: TEMECULA: Teen Cole Criske to battle on 'The Voice' - Press Enterprise

author: STEPHANIE SCHULTE
title: TEMECULA: Teen Cole Criske to battle on 'The Voice'
text:
BY STEPHANIE SCHULTE / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 19, 2015 Updated: 1:56 p.m. TEMECULA: Teen Cole Criske to battle on 'The Voice' Print Photo Share Pin It 1 of 2 More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Temecula resident Cole Criske is a contestant on seaon 9 of "The Voice." He enters the battle rounds on Tuesday, Oct. 20. TRAE PATTON , NBC Related article » Temecula teen Cole Criske will be in the homes of millions of Americans as he competes in the battle rounds of “The Voice” Tuesday night.
The 16-year-old wowed Gwen Stefani, Pharrell Williams and Blake Shelton during his blind audition on season 9 of the reality singing competition.
His soulful rendition of John Mayer’s “Dreaming with a Broken Heart,” had the three stars swiveling their chairs around to see who the voice belonged to. Criske will enter into the battle rounds Tuesday, Oct. 20 in hopes of staying on the show.
Criske chose country superstar Blake Shelton as his coach. Brad Paisley, John Fogerty, Missy Elliott and Selena Gomez are all advisers on this episode.
Tune in to see what song Criske sings and who he will battle at 9 p.m. on NBC.
Contact the writer: sschulte@pe.com , 951-368-9457
